reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Ch'ama warmi strong woman: reinforcing Aymara-women's political social and economic rights in the Bolivian Altiplano

description.narrative: Two-year project to help Aymara women from 6 communities: Jucuri Ninacho Pastogrande Pizacavina Caluyo and Jucumarca. The beneficiaries will be provided with tools such as greenhouses that enhance their production possibilities. They will receive training in agriculture that improves their autonomy social role and environmental sustainability. The women will take part in workshops about running associations designing and implementing micro-projects applying for funds and making agreements. Planned Results:R 1. Creating Women's Associations (WA) that are legally established democratically organized and can run micro-projects. R2. Aymara women get competences in agriculture production that reinforce their social status. Activities by result:R1.A1. Workshops abo ut human rights and gender equality. Topics include equality self-esteem leadership legal resources against domestic violence negotiation and fair division of responsibilities in the family.R1.A2. Workshops to form legally established Women's Associations. Supervised by legal experts that help designing statutes and rules registering the association. We will also support the WA's leaders to learn to run manage and organize the associations. R1.A3. Training about designing and implementing micro-projects. R2 .A1. Training in agricultural practices. The aim is to foster 10 concrete agricultural practices that aim to foster production and environmental sustainability.R2.A2. Workshops to improve marketing of products and designing new brand for their products. R2 .A3. Participation in Agricultural Meetings in the Urban and Suburban area and making contracts with firms and distributors to access new markets.R2.A4. Trainings in processing of vegetables I II and III.R2.A5. Introduction of new products to the market.AY MI's Project Coordinator will be in charge distributing the materials hiring personnel and services keeping contact with the Women's Associations and local authorities. Inter-Cultur will monitor and support from Finland and through annual visits.These skil ls together with the fact that distributed materials and competences are durable guarantee sustainability.
